paper_metadata.title: Exome Sequencing and Gene Prioritization Correct Misdiagnosis in a Chinese Kindred with Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.G148T, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 44-year-old male proband, additional affected subject IV:1

individual_records.phenotype_details: spreading progressive limbs weakness and paresthesia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (III:21) was a 44-year-old man, presenting with spreading progressive limbs weakness and paresthesia.
Based on self-reported symptoms followed by clinical evaluation, we could only confirm one other affected subject (IV:1) with similar sensory-motor neuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The variant results in a Valine-for-Lysine substitution at the 50th amino acid position, previously reported as pathogenic.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR variant segregates into all branches in which offspring reported neuropathy in deceased parents.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on segregation and clinical presentation
variants.additional_notes: The variant was confirmed through haplotype analysis.
key_quotes: The same amino acid substitution was previously reported as a pathogenic variant causing transthyretin-related familial amyloid polyneuropathy in a Japanese family.
The TTR variant segregates into all branches in which offspring reported neuropathy in deceased parents.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted successfully.
